p: The previously reported acyclic triterpenes; 2-hydroxymethyl-2,3,22,23-tetrahydroxy-6,10,15,19,23-pentamethyl-6,10,14,18-tetracosatetraene ( 132) and 2,3,22,23-tetrahydroxy-2,6,10,15,19,23-hexamethyl-6,10,14,18-tetracosatetraene ( 133) were isolated from the leaves of the Ekebergia capensis (Meliaceae) harvested in Kenya [ 80]. The compounds (Fig. 28) exhibited selective antiplasmodial activity against the W2 strain, with IC 50 values of 27.1 and 56.1 µM, and against the D6 66.9 and 64.3 µM, respectively [ 80].
